children.name: Basic Placeholders
children.content:
The name of this snippet (Basic Placeholders):
$[NAME]

The folder this snippet is in (Placeholders):
$[FOLDER]

The full path to this snippet (Snippets/Placeholders):
$[PATH]

Same as above with a custom delimiter (Snippets > Placeholders):
$[PATH( > )]

The name and version of your browser:
$[HOSTAPP]

The User Agent your browser identifies as:
$[UA]

children.name: Date
children.content:
The default date display for the locale:
$[DATE]

The current date and time with custom formatting:
$[DATE(ddd, MMM DD, YYYY hh:mm:ss A ZZ)]

Locale-based date strings of decreasing length:
$[DATE(full)]
$[DATE(long)]
$[DATE(medium)]
$[DATE(short)]

children.name: Time
children.content:
The default time display:
$[TIME]

The current time with custom formatting:
$[TIME(h:mm A Z)]

Locale-based time strings of decreasing length:
$[TIME(full)]
$[TIME(long)]
$[TIME(medium)]
$[TIME(short)]

children.name: Counters (manage in the settings menu)
children.content:
A default auto-incrementing counter (1 > 2):
#[COUNTER]

Numbers in brackets will change the increment. Note that this behaviour is not currently compatible with Clippings.

This will increase COUNTER by 2 after replacement (2 > 4):
#[COUNTER(2)]

This will decrease COUNTER by 2 after replacement (4 > 2):
#[COUNTER(-2)]

This will preserve the value of COUNTER after replacement (2 > 2):
#[COUNTER(0)]

children.name: RichText
children.content:
This is a rich text sample

By default, regular new lines like these two: will be marked with rich text line break (
) tags so they won't turn into spaces. URLs without anchor tags like https://github.com/jpc-ae/Snippets/issues will be hotlinked automatically along with email addresses like noreply@example.com. This behaviour can be changed in the settings menu. The copy button at the top right of this snippet will add both plain and rich text versions of this processed snippet ($[PATH]/$[NAME]) to the clipboard, just like if you'd copied it from a webpage.

children.name: [NOSUBST] Disabled
children.content:
The following text will be pasted as-is:
$[NAME], $[FOLDER], $[PATH]
$[HOSTAPP], $[UA]
#[COUNTER]
$[DATE], $[TIME]
unlinked.com, email@unlinked.com

children.name: Overview
children.content:
Welcome to Snippets!

On the top line you will find a settings menu, the current folder path, a sync icon that allows you to swap between syncronizing your snippets or keeping them local, buttons for adding new folders and snippets in the current folder and a pop-out button to make organizing your snippets easier.

Clicking on a folder name will open it. Try clicking the Placeholders folder to see how the path updates.

children.name: ðŸ¢€ Try clicking the icon!
children.content:
Folders and snippets each have an icon that can be clicked for a menu. The options currently available allow you to change the icon colour and move the item up or down manually. To move items around in a list, you can also drag their titles and drop them into a folder or position.

On the right are buttons to rename or delete the item. Once you get the hang of it, feel free to delete the tutorials!
